Text: These will not play on the WDHD Media Player...they lock it up.You need to do a reboot of the WDHD to be able to play any other files also.

Krank: try extracting audio and video, then rebuilt

BOZX: thanks buddy!

mkv files haven't worked on the WDHD Media Player for a long time, you have to use MKVMerge GUI and tick 'Disable header removal compression for audio and video tracks by default', then remux the file.
Western Digital can't be bothered to update their firmware to properly support the mkv standard.
It's ridiculous that something so simple can lock up the player.
